fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13475].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
'Switch filter' link has no filter options after clicking it for second time.

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
- Open a board
- Go to 'Issues' view
- Click on 'Switch filter'
- Choose a filter
- Click on 'Switch filter' and no result will be returned

h3. Expected Results
 !Screen Shot 2016-04-04 at 9.53.54 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
 !Screen Shot 2016-04-04 at 9.54.30 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workarounds
Refresh the page
fields.summary: Switch filter is blank

fields.description:
I would like to be able to use a board (kanban-like) for process management projects e.g. operational development issues/tasks. 

One can use the current kanban board but it expects that tasks are released using a Fix Version. The term version has no relation to some of the operational development task (e.g. "Upgrade JIRA").

So in short - I want some kind of board that doesn't care about versions/releases.
fields.summary: Using a Kanban board with a Process Management project

fields.description:
There is a spelling mistake in one of the messages shown on Reports Quick Timesheet page.

Steps to reproduce:
1] Click on Reports link on the header tab.
2] Click on Quick Timesheet
3] Enter project name in Projets field.
4] Run the query

In my case there were no matching records found. Following message showed up saying 

We are unable to find any records mathcing the following criteria:
(project in ("DEV")) AND (timespent > 0)

Here spelling of matching word is wrong.
fields.summary: Spelling mistake on Reports Quick Timesheet page

fields.description:
Environment:
JIRA: 7.1.2
BitBucket server: 4.3.2
Application Link: OAuth

Steps to Reproduce:
* Create an Applink between JIRA and BitBucket
* Configure it as OAuth
* Set the View Development Tools as "Anyone"
* Login as a jira-software user, Development panel is visible.
* When you logout, development panel is not displayed. 

Expected Result:
- Development panel should be visible as it was set to "Anyone".

Actual Result:
- Development panel is not displayed.

As per this page, https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver070/jira-applications-overview-762877655.html _View Development Information_ should be only be  visible to jira-software users. Hence, the option to set it to _Anyone_ has to be removed as it creates unnecessary confusion for customers.
fields.summary: View Development Tools set to Anyone is not working

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13469].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Creating an Issue in Epic while in Detail Search View doesn’t work

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud (7.2.0-OD-05-022)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Perform an Issue search and filter Epics
# View a specific Issue with Detail View
# Browse to the “Issues in Epic” session
# Click on the *+* button
# Observe the “Epic Link” field

h3. Expected Results
The Epic Links field is automatically populated by the currently viewed Epic

h3. Actual Results
The Epic Link field is grayed out and uneducable
 
h3.Workaround
If you click through into the Issue itself, you can use the *+* button and observe that the field is properly auto-populated
fields.summary: Creating an Issue in Epic link while in Detail Search View doesn’t work

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13468].
  {panel}

# View the backlog for a board.
# click-and-hold an issue (i.e. to drag it to a new position in the backlog).
# Try to use mousewheel or keyboard (pgup/pgdown/home/end) to navigate the backlog.

*Expected behavior:*
These should work just like they do when not 'dragging' an issue

*Actual behavior:*
They don't work at all.

*Impact:* 
User is forced to bump-scroll the issue, which is very frustrating.  This is made much worse by JRA-60336.
fields.summary: Backlog can't be navigated via mouse wheel or keyboard while dragging an issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13467].
  {panel}

This used to work as expected, but broke ~1 week ago.

# View the backlog for a board.
# Select an issue in the backlog.
# Create a new issue

*Expected behavior:*
The new issue appears in the backlog beneath the selected issue.

*Actual behavior:*
# The new issue does not appear anywhere in the backlog. 
# User has to refresh the page for the new issue to appear
# The new issue appears at the bottom of the backlog

*Impact:* 
This is incredibly frustrating when creating issues in a large backlog, because the process of having to click-and-drag the issue to where you want it in the backlog is so awful (see JRA-60337).
fields.summary: Problems with creating new issues in backlog

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Trials should be fully functional but when creating a jira software project you are unable to use Business Value as an estimation statistic. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a trial. 
# Create a JIRA software project. 
# Create a board based off the project.
. 

h3. Expected Results
Business value should be available as an estimation statistic. 
h3. Actual Results
Attempt to set an estimation statistic Business value is not available

h3. Notes
[Try Hosted Software|https://www.atlassian.com/ondemand/signup/] for reference to documentation of trails that are fully functional.
fields.summary: Business Value cannot be set as an estimation statistic on Atlassian trials.

fields.summary: Agile Board: org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getSidebarHtml'

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a sprint includes issues from different projects, users are not able to click on *Complete sprint* if they do not have *Manage sprints* permissions on all related projects.

h3. Suggested Solution
Users want to include in the tooltip that "To complete a sprint, Manage Sprints permission should be granted in all projects that have been pulled into the sprint.". With this tooltip, they will be more likely to try fixing the issue first before contacting support.
fields.summary: As a user, I want to be warned when my sprint includes issues from multiple projects

fields.description:
REST Request :
*/rest/agile/1.0/board/37/sprint?startAt=0&maxResults=50*

Returns reponse :

*{"errorMessages":["The board must be ordered by Rank in order to add a sprint"],"errors":{}}*

# Here I am just fetching Sprints for board 37 but error message is saying that I am trying to add sprint in this board which is not correct. REST query is just for fetching sprints.
# Even if RANK is disabled, I should be able to at least fetch Sprints via REST API.
fields.summary: Not able to fetch JIRA sprints for board when RANK query is disabled in filter

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Creating a JIRA Software Project (Scrum, Kanban or Basic), if the Issue Types "Epic" or "Story" exist but are not of type "Standard" the project creation fails.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Software

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Remove Issue Types "Story" or "Epic" if they exist.
# Create an Issue Type called "Story" or "Epic" of type" "Sub-Task"
# Create a Scrum, Kanban or Basic Software project

h3. Expected Results
The project is created with either the same Issue Type that exists or a new one that meets the requirements. Else, a message on screens specifies the problem so it can be corrected.

h3. Actual Results
On the last step of the project creation, the following message is shown:
{quote}
Hmm... we couldn't create your project due to an unknown error. Try refreshing the page to start again.
{quote}

Basic Software fails with Story issue type although it is not on the scheme.


h3.Workaround
Remove (or rename if in use by other custom project) issue types "Story" and "Epic" and create a new project. The issue types will be recreated automatically.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As of [JIRA Software 7.1|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARE/JIRA+Software+7.1.x+release+notes], when completing a Sprint, a popup will appear allowing the Admin to choose a Destination for Incomplete Issues if there are Sprints Scheduled.  By Default, the Backlog is Selected; in previous versions of JIRA Software (Agile), incomplete issues were automatically moved into the Next Scheduled Sprint. 

This causes a problem and a delay in workflow as the incomplete issues are moved back into the backlog and need to be found and manually moved into the next sprint.

h3. Suggested Solution
If there are Scheduled Sprints, the Destination Selection should default to the Next Scheduled Sprint rather than the Backlog
 
h3. Workaround 
Ensure the Next Scheduled Sprint is selected before Completing current Sprint
fields.summary: Destination Selection When Completing a Sprint Should Default to Next Scheduled Sprint
Sprint value drop-down menu hidden behind column names on Agile board
Get projects api doesn't return projects if jql does not have project in it.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In an active sprint, issues are still editable. This allows requirements to be changed and potentially affects the work.

h3. Suggested Solution

Make issues non-editable when a sprint starts.This is essential for devs to go with their stories as planned and to avoid changing the requirements during an active sprint.
fields.summary: Disable story editing in active sprints

fields.description:
This issue has occurred a few times, and it's very devious. It can be very hard to impossible to diagnose by the project admins, and it's caused by a very simple error. Here's how it happens:

# User 1 is project admin in project A, but not in project B. He doesn't even have Browse Issues rights, so project B and its issues are essentially invisible
# User 2 is project admin in project B, but not on project A
# User 1 uses a Scrum board and starts a sprint
# User 2 reports an issue in project B. That issue's Create screen contains the Sprint field, but User 2 makes a mistakes: He manually types in the wrong sprint, and inadvertantly add that new issue to the sprint for project A
# User 1 attempts to close his sprint, but is met with a problem: He's not admin of project B. Since he doesn't even have Browse Issue rights, he's not allowed to see the name of the project this intruder issue belongs to. 
# User 1 is smart and goes in Issues and filters for issues belonging to his sprint, but since he has no Browse Issues rights, he doesn't see the issue that's out of place.
# At this point, a JIRA admin has to get involved and must track down the problem. User 1 could not have found the problem, and user 2 couldn't have known about it until he was closing his own sprint and noticed the absence of an issue there.

If user 1 had been project admin on project B as well, the sprint would have closed without errors, but this would have been a worse outcome. User 2 would have had an issue disappear from his backlog because it would be part of a closed sprint, and user 1 would have weird sprint reports.

I see how this would be tricky to prevent. You would need a condition that "only issues that pass the filter for the board that created the sprint can be added to a sprint". Still, this seems like a huge problem area.
fields.summary: Project admin has an issue incorrectly added in his sprint and can't find which without a system admin

fields.description:
The colored text that shows on a card when viewing a board is entirely dependent on the Epic being available in the filter.

Keeping it out doesn't help with information control: you can open the card and still see the Epic it's tied to, it simply prevents you from seeing it on the card in that specific view.

Appending "|| Type = Epic" to filters can be counter-intuitive just to get this feature.
fields.summary: Epics On Cards Should Show Regardless Of Filters

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, at [Evaluations License FAQ|https://www.atlassian.com/licensing/purchase-licensing#evaluations], there are no limitations documented in terms of JIRA/JIRA Software/JIRA Service Desk Application Usage when the Evaluation license expires. 

h3. Suggested Solution
To include information about the limitations when the Evaluation license expires.
fields.summary: Update Licensing FAQ to include limitation when Evaluation license expires

fields.description:
Hi
We all agree that a JIRA ticket would transition if its linked code reviews are reviewed and closed. If one of these code reviews is open, then the JIRA issue shouldn't be transitioned.
However, there is an issue (in my opinion) for it: What happens when a linked code review is at Draft, Abandoned or Summarized state? What it seems is that there is a code change committed against the ticket and its Crucible code review is created but is on Draft state. At the JIRA ticket side, there are transitions that shouldn't appear because of the code review is not closed regardless of being reviewed or not.

Is there a way that at JIRA workflow transition, set a condition that the ticket shouldn't be transitioned when at least one of the code reviews is open, draft, abandoned, or summarized.

Thanks
fields.summary: JIRA Workflow condition in terms of non open/closed code review statuses

fields.description:
I've found a number of JIRAs about the Issue Detail View. I think some of the frustration I read in the comments on them is because people are experiencing what we are experiencing and the request to address this is getting confused with other issues with the Issue Detail View. 

We don't use/need Issue Detail View. When we click on a card, we want to see the View Issue screen. As is today, clicking on the card or link on card, goes to Issue Detail View. Then we have to click on link there to get to View Issue screen. This is an extra step that we have to do hundreds of times a day. 

The current board option "Hide detail view / Show detail view" *+opens and closes+* the Issue Detail View side panel, but it doesn't *+turn on and off+* the Issue Detail View. Enable it to be turned off so people who don't use it don't have to hop through it to get to the Issue View they do use. The ability to get to the View Issue screen with ctrl+click in another tab doesn't help because it's still another step to the View Issue screen. 

From clicking on issues from filter results, we're trained to expect issue keys to take us to the View Issue screen. We want that behavior to be consistent every time we click on an issue key. If someone doesn't like/use the Issue Detail View, getting sent there is very annoying.  

(on) *What if clicking on the card, opens Issue Detail View, and clicking on the issue key, as it does everywhere else, opens the View Issue screen.*
* Good GUI uses consistent behavior
* The issue keys, as they do across Atlassian products, go to the View Issue screen
* The card, as a feature of Agile Boards, goes to the Issue Detail View, a view which also is a feature of Agile Boards
fields.summary: On boards, have ability to choose: open View Issue screen, not Issue Detail View, from card link

fields.description:
Our organization uses JIRA as a cross-functional task management tool and as a result, some project delivery teams have a coordinated release cadence whereas others are on their own schedules.  The coordinated release teams would like to streamline the usage and filter results of fix versions, but we often find they get "creative" with fix version naming (even when it's an option in the dropdown already since the field can be free-form text).

-Is there a way to make the Fixed Version field a single-select dropdown with administrator-set selections in the drop-down?

-Is there a way to apply this change ONLY to some teams and not for others in JIRA?  E.g. is there a way to use a Project Category field. 

-Is there any anticipated impact of this change on filters/dashboard capabilities? 

Thanks!
val

h3. Summary

Moving issue using "edit issue" from the backlog to active sprint will cause the issue to be place in a random location 

h3. Environment

* JIRA Version: 7.2.0-OD-03-014
* JIRA Agile - 7.2.2-D20160229T170744
* Chrome: Version 49.0.2623.87 (64-bit)


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Navigate to Scrum board > Backlog tab
# Select an issue that is located in the backlog 
# Edit issue (using shortcut key "e") > Type in the name of an active sprint
# Update issue > Sprint scope will be affected by this action > Confirm
# Issue is added to active sprint, however it position in a random location on the active sprint. 

h3. Expected Results

Issue added to active sprint should be added to bottom to keep Rank integrity of the board. This also allow for easier sorting and rank assignment by the end user.

h3. Actual Results

* Issue is sent to the middle (random location) of the active sprint after using the edit function on a board

Behavior does not occur when you right click on issue and use "send to" an active sprint. Issue is added to the bottom of the active sprint.

h3.Workaround

* Right click and sent to the active sprint
* Drag issue from backlog into active sprint
* Edit issue and then move the appropriate place

fields.description:
According to https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile064/jira-agile-user-s-guide/using-a-board, The Instant Filter filters as follows:

_Type an issue key, issue type, or part of the issue summary, and JIRA Agile will instantly start searching for matches and filtering the displayed backlog, letter by letter as you type._

My team tries to use Jira Agile as exclusively as possible - one consistent UI and all of that.  Currently, if we want to search for an issue by description or comment (hey, we are definitely working on TAKING THINGS OUT OF EMAIL!), I have to flip over to Jira. Find the issue, flip back to Jira Agile and filter by key.  Bleh.

I suppose it would be ideal for the filter to work on components, labels, etc.  But, adding only Description and Comments would be sublime.

Signed, your humble Atlassian Evangelist, converting them, one at a time.  Easier with this feature. :)
fields.summary: As a Product Owner, I would like the Jira Agile Instant Filter to filter by Description and Comments

fields.description:
I know this has been raised in other tickets, but they seem to refer to server installs, not Cloud.

I have a board showing sub-tasks in swimlanes by their story.  Story is "Team A" or "Team B".  I want to be able to make a quick-filter to show only Stories (and their sub-tasks) for Team A or B, however if I use 
{{"Assigned Team" = "Team A"}}
then the sub-tasks don't show as they don't have "Assigned Team".  If I try something like
{{"Assigned Team" = "Team A" or issuetype in subTaskIssueTypes()}}
then all stories (Team A or B) with any subtasks show up as swimlanes, when I only want to see the stories with Team A (and their subtasks) 

If sub-queries are a no-go for some reason in Cloud, then please propose how this can be done
I want to really do something like
{{"Assigned Team" = "Team A" or (issuetype in subTaskIssueTypes() AND "parent.Assigned Team" = "Team A")}}
or
{{"Assigned Team" = "Team A" or (issuetype in subTaskIssueTypes() AND parent("Assigned Team") = "Team A")}}

For now we've added a post-function on sub-task Create Transition to set the sub-task Team value from the parent, but if the parent Team is changed, then the sub-tasks don't get updated.  

This sub-query, or parent-attribute capability is essential to make these boards useful for our teams.

I suspect a similar ability to refer to the attributes of an issue's Epic-link would also be of value (again, sub-query or other more limited approach).
fields.summary: ability to refer to attributes of sub-task Parent (JIRA-Cloud)

h3. Summary
Double byte characters get garbled when searching Confluence page to link to a Sprint if JIRA Software is running on Windows environment.

h3. Environment
* The problem happens if JIRA Software is running on Windows environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA Software 7.1.1 on Windows environment
# Install Confluence 5.9.6 (OS doesn't matter)
# Create an Application Link between them
# Create a Board in JIRA Software
# Create a Sprint in the Board
# Go to *Backlog* and click *Linked pages*
# Click *Link page* and search Confluence pages having title with double byte characters
# The search result is shown, however, the title is garbled (this is the problem)

h3. Expected Results
# The search result is shown properly

h3. Actual Results
# The search result is shown, however, the title is garbled. 
 
h3. Notes
JIRA Software searches Confluence pages by /rest/searchv3/\{version\}/search. The return value is in UTF-8. So I guess it is JIRA Software's bug (not Confluence's)

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround found at the moment

fields.description:
This suggestion is related to the limited Smart Commits available between Svn/Git, Fisheye, and JIRA.  Although Smart Commits can edit the workflow status, comments, and time spent on Issues- they cannot edit other fields within an Issue.  Editing other fields is often required when changing an Issue's workflow status, such as assigning a Fix Version or Tester to the Issue.

My suggestion is to allow special commands/syntax to be placed into an Issue's comment and affect some change onto that Issue (like clicking Edit and manually changing fields).  This way, the Smart Commit "#comment" could be used to place a command such as "#assignfixversion-amq5.1.4" into the JIRA comment.  JIRA would then see this and edit the Issue assigning the Fix Version as AMQ5.1.4.  Other possibilities could be #rename, #changeassignee, #changecomponent, etc.

Smart Commits save some time but not when you still have to go into JIRA and update certain Issue fields manually during the development process.  If JIRA could execute commands straight from it's Issue Comments- we could get around the limited scope of the Smart Commits by using them to input those commands to the Comment.
fields.summary: Ability to edit JIRA Issue Fields through Comments (smart commits)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13334].
{panel}
h3. Summary

On the [Cumulative Flow Diagram |https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Viewing+the+Cumulative+Flow+Diagram] adding quick filters, Columns, and Swimlanes extends the overall length of the *Refine Reports* report filter drop down modal and will push the apply and cancel buttons beyond the window, with no option to scroll down.
h3. Environment

Verified with:
 * Chrome Version 71.0.3578.98 (Official Build) (64-bit)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create multiple [quick filters |https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Configuring+Quick+Filters], [Columns |https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-user-s-guide/jira-agile-tutorials/tutorial-adding-a-column-to-a-board], and [Swimlanes |https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-user-s-guide/configuring-a-board/configuring-swimlanes] in the board configuration
 # on [Cumulative Flow Diagram |https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Viewing+the+Cumulative+Flow+Diagram]
 # Select Refine Report dropdown

h3. Expected Results

Ability to scroll if the options exceed the available Space
h3. Actual Results

The *apply* and *Cancel* buttons are cut off along with any options that extend below the window:

 !Screen Shot 2019-01-29 at 9.51.32.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

This impacts users with smaller screens and Lower resolution settings the most, but also impacts anyone with complex boards using many columns, with multiple swimlanes and then use many quick filters to better organize the complex board.
h3. Workaround

* Zoom out in the browser until the apply option is visible and can be selected, or press *esc* to close the dialogue to cancel any setting changes
* Type tab key to switch the selected filter so that you can click the *apply* or *cancel* buttons
fields.summary: Refine Filters Modal dialog hides buttons on Cumulative Flow report

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a sprint is closed but it still have open issues, then the issues go back to backlog (or a new sprint). If an user tries editing the sprint field on one of these issues, he has the option to add a new value but he can't remove the closed sprint. When the sprint field is edited through 'Bulk Operation', the closed sprint is removed from the field and so a new value is added instead of keeping both.

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# Create a sprint
# Create an issue and add it to the sprint
# Close the sprint and move open issues to backlog
# Open the issue created on step 2 and try editing sprint field
#* You won't be able to remove sprint created on step 1 however you'll be able to add a new sprint
# Run a search that returns that issue, then choose _Tools_ > _Bulk Change_ > Select the issue
# Choose _Edit_ option then enter a new value for sprint field
# Open the issue created on step 2, there'll see the sprint created on step 1 is no longer shown on sprint field

h3. Expected Results
Issue should keep closed sprint information

h3. Actual Results
The value of sprint field is replaced

h3. Additional notes (added on 03/07/2019)
*_The issue itself is that closed sprints are editable when you perform a bulk operation._*
Another way to reproduce this issue, if you perform a bulk operation and set the issue id of a closed sprint, the bulk operation will complete and let you add issues into the closed sprint.
fields.summary: Closed sprints are editable via bulk operations.

fields.description:
With all of the Backlog, Epic, and Version management coming to the Kanban boards, I'd like to throw in consideration for a new report.

For Kanban teams that are using Story Point estimation, there isn't a great way to get a general sense of Velocity without custom queries and manually adding things up.  There also isn't a great way to see the impact of Story Points size to actual effect on your cycle time (e.g. a "1" might take 3d, and "5" might take 2w).

These two things would be very helpful:
- A new Velocity Segmentation report where we can look across the history of the done work in the project and hone in on specific timeframes, with Story Points adding up on the fly.  I could see this being part of either the Control Chart or Cumulative Flow very easily (Flow makes more sense). 
-- Very few Kanban teams enjoy consistent and similar sized work to lean exclusively on a Control Chart.  Velocity in conjunction with the Control Chart helps get a better understanding of flow.
- Matrix of Story Point values as filters in the Control Chart by default (no need to make quick filters for them)
fields.summary: Story Point and Velocity Segmentation for Kanban

JIRA should display the attachment name as read only (not a link).

fields.description:
For those of us who are still running JIRA Agile on Server version < 7.0, it is extremely frustrating not to have documentation for both the basic REST API and the agile (Greenhopper) REST API. For example, on our server, this GET command works:

<server>/rest/greenhopper/1.0/project

but unexpectedly this does not

<server>/rest/greenhopper/1.0/sprint

The currently available agile REST API documentation (https://docs.atlassian.com/greenhopper/REST/cloud/) is no help. It says that this call should work:

GET /rest/agile/1.0/board

but neither it (results in 404 error) nor any guessed-at variation of this call works on our server. For example, the call <server>/rest/greenhopper/1.0/board results in:

<status>
<status-code>404</status-code>
<message>
null for uri: http://jira.roguewave.com/rest/greenhopper/1.0/board
</message>
</status>

Could you take pity on us and post the api and greenhopper documentation for server 6.x somewhere? I know your preferred solution would be for us to upgrade to the current JIRA version, but developers do not always have control of such things, which upper managers see more in terms of time/effort/cost.

Many thanks for whatever help you can give.
fields.summary: JIRA Greenhopper REST documentation not available
Detail why JIRA needs the permissions listed on the Oracle documentation.

fields.summary: Unable to complete sprint because sub-task is not resolved - JW9612 Not Resolved

fields.description:
Default JIRA 6.4 installs HSQL database. HSQL database is not supported in the 7.1 migration. The upgrade script doesn't tell you this, and if you run the script, it causes the JIRA install to essentially be corrupt, requiring you to uninstall JIRA completely, as far as I can tell from the community answers.

Compounding the issue, it is very difficult to locate the 6.4 installer on the website now, which is required to remedy the problem. Try locating it with Google or on the Atlassian home page.

For more information and a screenshot of the error see the support question:
[https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/37039777/migrating-6.4-to-7.0-while-on-deprecated-hsql-on-linux-error-message-says-to-start-jira-7.0-but-does-not-state-how-to-do-this]


*Expected result:*

JIRA upgrade script should fail early with an error saying you must first migrate your database before migrating to 7.1
fields.summary: Default JIRA 6.4 installation not supported in 7.1 migration script on Linux
